simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-09T15:24:57.000Z ##

Why you should care about CVE-2024-21762:

Fortinet vulnerabilities have historically been targeted by People’s Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored cyber actors. On 19 January 2023, Mandiant reported the exploitation of FortiOS SSL VPN vulnerability CVE-2022-42475 as a zero-day by suspected Chinese threat actors. Mandiant published a subsequent blog post on 16 March 2023 detailing the exploitation of another FortiOS zero-day CVE-2022-41328 by the Chinese threat actor UNC3886. CISA, FBI and NSA assess that PRC state-sponsored cyber actors are seeking to position themselves on IT networks for disruptive or destructive cyberattacks against U.S. critical infrastructure in the event of a major crisis or conflict with the United States. CISA’s joint cybersecurity advisory on 07 February 2024 states that Chinese Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) Volt Typhoon likely obtained initial access by exploiting CVE-2022-42475 in a network perimeter FortiGate 300D firewall that was not patched. Fortinet also provided case studies of Volt Typhoon targeting of manufacturing, consulting, local government, and internet service provider sectors, and post-exploitation activity described as Living Off the Land (LotL) techniques.

#Fortinet #FortiOS #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_21762 #vulnerability #securityadvisory

  • FG-IR-23-268 FortiManager - Informative error messages

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T15:22:54.000Z ##

Unit 42 reports on a new variant of Mispadu Stealer, an infostealer targeting specific regions and URLs associated with Mexico. The infostealer was discovered while hunting for the SmartScreen CVE-2023-36025 security feature bypass vulnerability. They provided a sample analysis, and IOC.

##

CVE-2022-48618
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.69%

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.1, watchOS 9.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1.

jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-02-02T19:40:01.000Z ##

🍏 CISA warns of patched iPhone kernel bug now exploited in attacks
— Bleeping Computer

"Tracked as CVE-2022-48618 and discovered by Apple's security researchers, the bug was only disclosed on January 9th in an update to a security advisory published in December 2022."

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-warns-of-patched-iphone-kernel-bug-now-exploited-in-attacks/

#iPhone #Exploit #CVE202248618 #Cybersecurity

##

CVE-2023-5631
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.68%

2 posts

Roundcube before 1.4.15, 1.5.x before 1.5.5, and 1.6.x before 1.6.4 allows stored XSS via an HTML e-mail message with a crafted SVG document because of program/lib/Roundcube/rcube_washtml.php behavior. This could allow a remote attacker to load arbitrary JavaScript code.

simontsui at 2024-02-12T15:20:01.863Z ##

Why you should care about CVE-2023-43770:
ESET Research previously reported on 25 October 2023 that the Winter Vivern APT was exploiting a similar RoundCube cross-site scripting vulnerability CVE-2023-5631 as a zero-day against European overnmental entities and a think tank.

Hot off the press! CISA added both Microsoft zero-days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-21412 (8.1 high) Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21351 (7.6 high) Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/02/13/cisa-adds-two-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#Microsoft #securityadvisory #PatchTuesday #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_21412 #CVE_2024_21351 #vulnerability #MSRC #CISA #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #KEV

##
simontsui at 2024-02-13T18:47:27.859Z ##

See related Trend Micro article: APT Water Hydra (a.k.a. DarkCasino) targeted financial market traders. In late December 2023, Trend Micro began tracking a campaign by the Water Hydra group that contained similar tools, tactics, and procedures (TTPs) that involved abusing internet shortcuts (.URL) and Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) components. "In this attack chain, the threat actor leveraged CVE-2024-21412 to bypass Microsoft Defender SmartScreen and infect victims with the DarkMe malware." IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/b/cve202421412-water-hydra-targets-traders-with-windows-defender-s.html

#Microsoft #securityadvisory #PatchTuesday #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_21412 #CVE_2024_21351 #vulnerability #MSRC #IOC #threatintel #zeroday #WaterHydra #DarkCasino

##

CVE-2023-36460
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.41%

1 posts

N/A

techbites@techbites.info at 2024-02-04T06:26:12.000Z ##

Decentralized social network Mastodon has revealed a significant security flaw, potentially allowing malicious actors to impersonate and take control of any account. The maintainers issued a concise advisory, stating that insufficient origin validation across all Mastodon versions enables this vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23832, the severity rating is 9.4 out of 10, and security researcher arcanicanis is credited with discovering and reporting it.

Described as an “origin validation error” (CWE-346), this flaw could grant attackers access to inadvertently accessible functionalities. Versions vulnerable include all Mastodon releases before 3.5.17, 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

To prevent exploitation, Mastodon has chosen to withhold detailed technical information until February 15, 2024. This delay allows administrators sufficient time to update server instances. The federated nature of Mastodon, operating on separate servers (instances), emphasizes the importance of timely security updates by administrators to safeguard against potential risks.

This disclosure follows Mastodon’s addressing of two critical flaws nearly seven months ago (CVE-2023-36460 and 2023-36459), emphasizing the ongoing commitment to enhancing platform security.

https://techbites.info/fediverse/critical-security-flaw-in-mastodon-exposes-account-takeover-risks/

#fediverse #Infosec #mastoadmin #mastodon #News #Privacy #security #tech

(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.37%

1 posts

Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.129 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

Elastic security advisory: Kibana 8.12.1, 7.17.18 Security Update. "Kibana includes a bundled version of headless Chromium that is only used for Kibana’s reporting capabilities and which is affected by" CVE-2023-7024 (8.8 high, disclosed 20 December 2023 by Google), Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC. Interestingly, Elastic rates the vulnerability even higher at 9.9 critical (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H)
🔗 https://discuss.elastic.co/t/kibana-8-12-1-7-17-18-security-update/352805

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.36%

1 posts

The py library through 1.11.0 for Python allows remote attackers to conduct a ReDoS (Regular expression Denial of Service) attack via a Subversion repository with crafted info data, because the InfoSvnCommand argument is mishandled. CVE-2020-3259
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.24%

8 posts

A vulnerability in the web services interface of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve memory contents on an affected device, which could lead to the disclosure of confidential information. The vulnerability is due to a buffer tracking issue when the software parses invalid URLs

simontsui at 2024-02-15T20:11:41.360Z ##

CISA adds two to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation:

  • CVE-2020-3259 (7.5 high, disclosed 06 May 2020 by Cisco) Cisco ASA and FTD Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21410 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, updated 14 Feb as exploited zero-day) Microsoft Exchange Server Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-6246
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

4 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when the openlog function was not called, or called with the ident argument set to NULL, and the program name (the basename of argv[0]) is bigger than 1024 bytes, resulting in an application crash or local privilege escalatio

Nuclei template

dalias@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-07T20:02:47.000Z ##

FWIW, @alpinelinux is not affected by CVE-2023-6246. 😁 🦪

petrillic@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-03T21:59:11.000Z ##

:chefs kiss: https://xeiaso.net//shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

##
alcinnz@floss.social at 2024-02-02T20:48:14.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens - Xe: https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

I do sympathize with the struggle to retrofit these type checks into such a well-established language, but...

##
ajn142@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T18:11:08.000Z ##

@dave_aitel @briankrebs

I do like the point of all the problems patching doesn’t solve. To do the bad thing and borrow military terminology into infosec, I think attack surface reduction is particularly applicable at the strategic level. This is something a CISO should be steering the organization as a whole towards. Patching and inventory are more akin to a tactical level, they’re basics and table stakes that need to be done to be effective, and can hurt significantly if done poorly but don’t help much if done right. Using an example from the article, anything you pick to run your mail server and webmail on besides MS Exchange very likely leverages glibc, and was potentially impacted by CVE-2023-6246. If you don’t patch things like that then congrats, you just undid the strategic efforts at ASR, but if you do patch it that and 2 bucks will buy you a Coke.

##

CVE-2023-20867
(3.9 LOW)

EPSS: 0.16%

2 posts

A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

jajo@mastodon.nu at 2024-02-09T18:01:27.000Z ##

Mandiant and VMware Product Security found that UNC3886 has been exploiting CVE-2023-20867 since 2021.

Mandiant recommends VMware users update to the latest version of vCenter to account for this vulnerability seeing exploitation in the wild. ⬇️
https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021

CVE-2023-42282(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.11%

1 posts

An issue in all published versions of the NPM package `ip` allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain sensitive information via the `isPublic()` function. This can lead to potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks. The core issue is the function's failure to accurately distinguish between public and private IP addresses.

thbley@phpc.social at 2024-02-12T19:59:37.000Z ##

IPv4 addresses may be represented in "any" notation expressing a 32-bit integer value.
CVE-2023-42282 https://github.com/indutny/node-ip/issues/136
- package has 22m downloads per week
- package is unmaintained for 2 years
Some IPv4 notations: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/having-fun-ip-addresses-christian-luger/

##

CVE-2023-40547
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.10%

1 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability was found in Shim. The Shim boot support trusts attacker-controlled values when parsing an HTTP response. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a specific malicious HTTP request, leading to a completely controlled out-of-bounds write primitive and complete system compromise.

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-07T23:01:17.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-40547 (CVSS score: 9.8), the vulnerability could be exploited to achieve a Secure Boot bypass. Bill Demirkapi of the Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has been credited with discovering and reporting the bug. https://thehackernews.com/2024/02/critical-bootloader-vulnerability-in.html

##

CVE-2024-23832
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-02-09T20:21:45.317000

61 posts

Mastodon is a free, open-source social network server based on ActivityPub Mastodon allows configuration of LDAP for authentication. Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior

hrefna@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T20:38:26.000Z ##

To start with, it is a pretty clear example of OWASP's API7:2023 (https://owasp.org/API-Security/editions/2023/en/0xa7-server-side-request-forgery/) and API3:2023 (https://owasp.org/API-Security/editions/2023/en/0xa3-broken-object-property-level-authorization/) and these are attack types that demand layered approaches.

As a fix what mastodon has out now is good, but for the future it's worth investing in these sorts of defense-in-depth strategies.

#mastodon #cve202423832

##
hrefna@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T20:25:04.000Z ##

Well I can see why this was a 9.8 https://arcanican.is/excerpts/cve-2024-23832/

It's worth considering what defense in depth would look like, beyond just fixing it (which is also important, patch your software). It looks like, at least at first glance, that there were a cascade of problems and defense at any level would have stopped it.

#mastodon #cve202423832

##
mima@makai.chaotic.ninja at 2024-02-14T06:34:21.101Z ##

Hey #Mastodon admins, just a reminder that the details of the critical #security vulnerability GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw/CVE-2024-23832 is going to be released tomorrow. ​:MokouWha:​ I still see some instances out there running a vulnerable version... ​:koishtare:​ Sent a DM to the admins of those instances of course. ​:cirno_fumo_yes:​ Please upgrade to a patched version (like 4.2.5 and 4.1.13) as soon as possible. ​:RumiaPray:​

#MastoAdmin #FediAdmin #CVE-2024-23832 #CVE202423832 #CVE_2024_23832 #CVE #GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw #GHSA3fjr858r92rw #GHSA_3fjr_858r_92rw #GHSA #GitHub #GitHubsecurityadvisory #cybersecurity #OriginValidation

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-13T22:43:42.000Z ##

The last few days have been slow in tracking adoption of the latest Mastodon patches, but registered user coverage has finally hit 97.0% 🎉

Some people have asked me to start publicly “naming and shaming” servers that haven't upgraded, but I'm not doing that. I can't verify that an admin didn't manually apply the patches to an older version, and I'm not about to go out and slander folks because of it.

The majority of vulnerable instances have one or two active users ... and then a significant amount of the larger servers are places that appear on common blocklists for poor moderation practices already…

#CVE202423832 #MastoAdmin

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-09T20:05:13.000Z ##

One week since the release of patches for #CVE202423832 and Mastodon coverage is now at:

76.4% of instances have been patched providing coverage for 96.7% of registered users and 95.3% of active users.

Details of the vulnerability are slated to be released after February 15. #MastoAdmin who have not updated their instances to a patched version (see https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw) should take be taking action immediately.

##
shanie@tails.ch at 2024-02-07T16:47:33.000Z ##

@vmstan They will soon be full of bots imitating their users (#CVE202423832) promoting literal garbage, phishing, spam.

Why would I stay federated with an instance whose admins don't care about their own instance or users?

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-07T16:20:59.000Z ##

Here's a great example of why the the update notifications built into Mastodon 4.2 are such a helpful feature to keep the network secure.

89% of 4.2 instances are secured against #CVE202423832 while only 16% of 4.1 instances are secured.

#MastoAdmin

##
Alen_T_Szabo at 2024-02-04T11:29:18.234Z ##

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/mastodon-vulnerability-allows-attackers-to-take-over-accounts/

#mastodon #cve202423832 #vulnerability

##
jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-02-03T13:40:00.000Z ##

🦣 Mastodon Exploit Allows for Remote Impersonation and Takeover
— wedistribute.org

"Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account.

Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5."

https://wedistribute.org/2024/02/mastodon-remote-takeover/

#Mastodon #Exploit #Cybersecurity #CVE202423832

##
neustradamus@mastodon.social at 2024-02-02T12:44:04.000Z ##

#Mastodon server administrators, please update your version, there is a #CVE fix (#CVE202423832)! (#OStatus / #ActivityPub / #Fediverse / #SocialNetwork) https://mastodon.social/

##
hrefna@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T20:38:26.000Z ##

To start with, it is a pretty clear example of OWASP's API7:2023 (https://owasp.org/API-Security/editions/2023/en/0xa7-server-side-request-forgery/) and API3:2023 (https://owasp.org/API-Security/editions/2023/en/0xa3-broken-object-property-level-authorization/) and these are attack types that demand layered approaches.

As a fix what mastodon has out now is good, but for the future it's worth investing in these sorts of defense-in-depth strategies.

#mastodon #cve202423832

##
hrefna@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T20:25:04.000Z ##

Well I can see why this was a 9.8 https://arcanican.is/excerpts/cve-2024-23832/

It's worth considering what defense in depth would look like, beyond just fixing it (which is also important, patch your software). It looks like, at least at first glance, that there were a cascade of problems and defense at any level would have stopped it.

#mastodon #cve202423832

##
mima@makai.chaotic.ninja at 2024-02-14T06:34:21.101Z ##

Hey #Mastodon admins, just a reminder that the details of the critical #security vulnerability GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw/CVE-2024-23832 is going to be released tomorrow. ​:MokouWha:​ I still see some instances out there running a vulnerable version... ​:koishtare:​ Sent a DM to the admins of those instances of course. ​:cirno_fumo_yes:​ Please upgrade to a patched version (like 4.2.5 and 4.1.13) as soon as possible. ​:RumiaPray:​

#MastoAdmin #FediAdmin #CVE-2024-23832 #CVE202423832 #CVE_2024_23832 #CVE #GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw #GHSA3fjr858r92rw #GHSA_3fjr_858r_92rw #GHSA #GitHub #GitHubsecurityadvisory #cybersecurity #OriginValidation

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-13T22:43:42.000Z ##

The last few days have been slow in tracking adoption of the latest Mastodon patches, but registered user coverage has finally hit 97.0% 🎉

Some people have asked me to start publicly “naming and shaming” servers that haven't upgraded, but I'm not doing that. I can't verify that an admin didn't manually apply the patches to an older version, and I'm not about to go out and slander folks because of it.

The majority of vulnerable instances have one or two active users ... and then a significant amount of the larger servers are places that appear on common blocklists for poor moderation practices already…

#CVE202423832 #MastoAdmin

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-09T20:05:13.000Z ##

One week since the release of patches for #CVE202423832 and Mastodon coverage is now at:

76.4% of instances have been patched providing coverage for 96.7% of registered users and 95.3% of active users.

Details of the vulnerability are slated to be released after February 15. #MastoAdmin who have not updated their instances to a patched version (see https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw) should take be taking action immediately.

##
shanie@tails.ch at 2024-02-07T16:47:33.000Z ##

@vmstan They will soon be full of bots imitating their users (#CVE202423832) promoting literal garbage, phishing, spam.

Why would I stay federated with an instance whose admins don't care about their own instance or users?

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-07T16:20:59.000Z ##

Here's a great example of why the the update notifications built into Mastodon 4.2 are such a helpful feature to keep the network secure.

89% of 4.2 instances are secured against #CVE202423832 while only 16% of 4.1 instances are secured.

#MastoAdmin

— wedistribute.org

"Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account.

Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5."

##
mima@makai.chaotic.ninja at 2024-02-14T06:34:21.101Z ##

Hey #Mastodon admins, just a reminder that the details of the critical #security vulnerability GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw/CVE-2024-23832 is going to be released tomorrow. ​:MokouWha:​ I still see some instances out there running a vulnerable version... ​:koishtare:​ Sent a DM to the admins of those instances of course. ​:cirno_fumo_yes:​ Please upgrade to a patched version (like 4.2.5 and 4.1.13) as soon as possible. ​:RumiaPray:​

#MastoAdmin #FediAdmin #CVE-2024-23832 #CVE202423832 #CVE_2024_23832 #CVE #GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw #GHSA3fjr858r92rw #GHSA_3fjr_858r_92rw #GHSA #GitHub #GitHubsecurityadvisory #cybersecurity #OriginValidation

##
deltatux@infosec.town at 2024-02-05T21:16:00.579Z ##

A new vulnerability in Mastodon was disclosed allowing attackers to perform account takeovers if they successfully exploit this vulnerability.

This vulnerability is being tracked as CVE-2024-23832 & has a 9.4/10 CVSS3 score, so it's a critical vulnerability.

As always, if you run a Mastodon instance, it's best if you can patch to the latest version as soon as possible.

www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/mastodon-vulnerability-allows-attackers-to-take-over-accounts/

#mastoadmin #mastodon #fediverse #patch #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23832

##
mima@makai.chaotic.ninja at 2024-02-14T06:34:21.101Z ##

Hey #Mastodon admins, just a reminder that the details of the critical #security vulnerability GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw/CVE-2024-23832 is going to be released tomorrow. ​:MokouWha:​ I still see some instances out there running a vulnerable version... ​:koishtare:​ Sent a DM to the admins of those instances of course. ​:cirno_fumo_yes:​ Please upgrade to a patched version (like 4.2.5 and 4.1.13) as soon as possible. ​:RumiaPray:​

#MastoAdmin #FediAdmin #CVE-2024-23832 #CVE202423832 #CVE_2024_23832 #CVE #GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw #GHSA3fjr858r92rw #GHSA_3fjr_858r_92rw #GHSA #GitHub #GitHubsecurityadvisory #cybersecurity #OriginValidation

##
deltatux@infosec.town at 2024-02-05T21:16:00.579Z ##

A new vulnerability in Mastodon was disclosed allowing attackers to perform account takeovers if they successfully exploit this vulnerability.

This vulnerability is being tracked as CVE-2024-23832 & has a 9.4/10 CVSS3 score, so it's a critical vulnerability.

As always, if you run a Mastodon instance, it's best if you can patch to the latest version as soon as possible.

##
hrefna@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T20:38:26.000Z ##

To start with, it is a pretty clear example of OWASP's API7:2023 (https://owasp.org/API-Security/editions/2023/en/0xa7-server-side-request-forgery/) and API3:2023 (https://owasp.org/API-Security/editions/2023/en/0xa3-broken-object-property-level-authorization/) and these are attack types that demand layered approaches.

As a fix what mastodon has out now is good, but for the future it's worth investing in these sorts of defense-in-depth strategies.

#mastodon #cve202423832

##
hrefna@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T20:25:04.000Z ##

Well I can see why this was a 9.8 https://arcanican.is/excerpts/cve-2024-23832/

It's worth considering what defense in depth would look like, beyond just fixing it (which is also important, patch your software). It looks like, at least at first glance, that there were a cascade of problems and defense at any level would have stopped it.

#mastodon #cve202423832

##
mima@makai.chaotic.ninja at 2024-02-14T06:34:21.101Z ##

#MastoAdmin #FediAdmin #CVE-2024-23832 #CVE202423832 #CVE_2024_23832 #CVE #GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw #GHSA3fjr858r92rw #GHSA_3fjr_858r_92rw #GHSA #GitHub #GitHubsecurityadvisory #cybersecurity #OriginValidation

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-13T22:43:42.000Z ##

The last few days have been slow in tracking adoption of the latest Mastodon patches, but registered user coverage has finally hit 97.0% 🎉

Some people have asked me to start publicly “naming and shaming” servers that haven't upgraded, but I'm not doing that. I can't verify that an admin didn't manually apply the patches to an older version, and I'm not about to go out and slander folks because of it.

The majority of vulnerable instances have one or two active users ... and then a significant amount of the larger servers are places that appear on common blocklists for poor moderation practices already…

#CVE202423832 #MastoAdmin

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-09T20:05:13.000Z ##

One week since the release of patches for #CVE202423832 and Mastodon coverage is now at:

76.4% of instances have been patched providing coverage for 96.7% of registered users and 95.3% of active users.

Details of the vulnerability are slated to be released after February 15. #MastoAdmin who have not updated their instances to a patched version (see https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw) should take be taking action immediately.

##
paul@oldfriends.live at 2024-02-16T01:07:27.000Z ##

@SpaceLifeForm @thisismissem @jerry @paco

arcanicanis posts an example of one of the maliciously-crafted payloads that resulted in a 9.8 severity CVE (CVE-2024-23832) against Mastodon at this post.

https://were.social/objects/cfe6a3fd-17d5-439f-b81a-7d750baca280

##
thisismissem@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-15T21:44:12.000Z ##

Wowzers, that Mastodon CVE recently was quite something:

• You can inject a post that is attributed to any remote user
• You can overwrite the server's copy of any remote user
• You can rekey the server's copy of any remote user, by just listing another key

The full technical write up is worth a read: https://arcanican.is/excerpts/cve-2024-23832/discovery.htm

##
h12o@mastodon.tokyo at 2024-02-14T11:25:58.000Z ##

GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw（CVE-2024-23832）の詳細開示、日本時間だと16日になるかもしれませんが保証はないので、バージョンアップはいつやるの?いまでしょ!としか。

##
snullp@c7.io at 2024-02-14T03:39:55.000Z ##

@board 首先祝大家情人节快乐❣️
纠结了半天还是打算跑出来破坏一下氛围，因为明天就是2月15日，也就是上面说的长毛象重大漏洞的公布日：https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw

更新：漏洞具体描述：https://arcanican.is/excerpts/cve-2024-23832/discovery.htm

因为这个漏洞的严重性，官方在补丁释出前就提前宣传过。补丁于2月1日释出，我在2月4日提醒大家漏洞非常致命各个实例一定要修复好。2月5日我直接私信提醒了很多尚未更新的中文长毛象站长。可是这么久过去了，以下过千用户的实例还是没有修复：

站长没有回复：
mao.mastodonhub.com
donotban.com (版本过老已经不被官方支持了，没有补丁。危！)

站长承诺会近期升级：
tea.codes

对于这种能让攻击者（包括国家）盗用用户身份，骗取信任和信息的漏洞，我希望大家不要觉得我是小题大做。请大家转发这条信息给你在这些实例里的小伙伴，让他们注意身份盗用的风险！

最后，如果想搬家，弱弱推荐一下自己的实例，https://c7.io。我们以商业站点的标准来搭建和运维，安全稳定方面请大家放心！

纠结了半天还是打算跑出来破坏一下氛围，因为明天就是2月15日，也就是上面说的长毛象重大漏洞的公布日：https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw

更新：漏洞具体描述：https://arcanican.is/excerpts/cve-2024-23832/discovery.htm

因为这个漏洞的严重性，官方在补丁释出前就提前宣传过。补丁于2月1日释出，我在2月4日提醒大家漏洞非常致命各个实例一定要修复好。2月5日我直接私信提醒了很多尚未更新的中文长毛象站长。可是这么久过去了，以下过千用户的实例还是没有修复：

站长没有回复：
mao.mastodonhub.com
donotban.com (版本过老已经不被官方支持了，没有补丁。危！)

站长承诺会近期升级：
tea.codes

对于这种能让攻击者（包括国家）盗用用户身份，骗取信任和信息的漏洞，我希望大家不要觉得我是小题大做。请大家转发这条信息给你在这些实例里的小伙伴，让他们注意身份盗用的风险！

最后，如果想搬家，弱弱推荐一下自己的实例，https://c7.io。我们以商业站点的标准来搭建和运维，安全稳定方面请大家放心！

##
SolamenteItan@masto.es at 2024-02-05T07:38:53.000Z ##

@davidochobits

Información sobre vulnerabilidad crítica CVE-2024-23832 en INCIBE-CERT: <https://www.incibe.es/incibe-cert/alerta-temprana/vulnerabilidades/cve-2024-23832>

##
techbites@techbites.info at 2024-02-04T06:26:12.000Z ##

Decentralized social network Mastodon has revealed a significant security flaw, potentially allowing malicious actors to impersonate and take control of any account. The maintainers issued a concise advisory, stating that insufficient origin validation across all Mastodon versions enables this vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23832, the severity rating is 9.4 out of 10, and security researcher arcanicanis is credited with discovering and reporting it.

Described as an “origin validation error” (CWE-346), this flaw could grant attackers access to inadvertently accessible functionalities. Versions vulnerable include all Mastodon releases before 3.5.17, 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

To prevent exploitation, Mastodon has chosen to withhold detailed technical information until February 15, 2024. This delay allows administrators sufficient time to update server instances. The federated nature of Mastodon, operating on separate servers (instances), emphasizes the importance of timely security updates by administrators to safeguard against potential risks.

This disclosure follows Mastodon’s addressing of two critical flaws nearly seven months ago (CVE-2023-36460 and 2023-36459), emphasizing the ongoing commitment to enhancing platform security.

https://techbites.info/fediverse/critical-security-flaw-in-mastodon-exposes-account-takeover-risks/

#fediverse #Infosec #mastoadmin #mastodon #News #Privacy #security #tech

##
makpikts@toot.lv at 2024-02-03T22:28:12.000Z ##

@atis Par citu tēmu: kā mums ar CVE-2024-23832 ?

##
hyde@lazybear.social at 2024-02-03T15:36:14.000Z ##

Don't forget to update to the latest #mastodon version! There is a vuln that allows attackers to hijack accounts (CVE-2024-23832)

##
hyoyoshikawa@toot.blue at 2024-02-03T08:54:21.000Z ##

mastodonの今回の緊急アップデート（v4.2.5）は以下の脆弱性（CVE-2024-23832）に緊急の対応が必要なため実施されました。未アップデートの鯖管理者は参考にしてください。

--------
CVE-2024-23832は、分散型ソーシャルネットワークプラットフォームであるMastodonに存在する重大な脆弱性です。この脆弱性により、攻撃者は不十分な起源検証のために、任意のMastodonアカウントをなりすまし、乗っ取ることが可能になります。問題は、認証リクエストの起源を適切に検証していない点にあります。

この脆弱性は、Mastodonの3.5.17より前のすべてのバージョンに影響し、4.0.x、4.1.x、4.2.xシリーズのバージョンも、それぞれ4.0.13、4.1.13、4.2.5より前のバージョンが影響を受けています

#脆弱性
#v4_2_5

##
vk6flab@mastodon.radio at 2024-02-02T19:51:20.000Z ##

@EI3JDB @M0YNG

A CVE with a 9.4 severity is NOT GOOD.

https://securityonline.info/mastodon-alert-cve-2024-23832-unlocks-account-takeover-threat/

Mastodon allows configuration of LDAP for authentication. Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5.

CVE-2024-1209
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

1 posts

The LearnDash LMS plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 4.10.1 via direct file access due to insufficient protection of uploaded assignments. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to obtain those uploads.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-02-13T23:05:03.000Z ##

##
simontsui at 2024-02-15T20:11:41.360Z ##

CISA adds two to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation:

  • CVE-2020-3259 (7.5 high, disclosed 06 May 2020 by Cisco) Cisco ASA and FTD Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21410 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, updated 14 Feb as exploited zero-day) Microsoft Exchange Server Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/02/15/cisa-adds-two-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#CISA #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2020_3259 #CVE_2024_21410 #Microsoft #vulnerability #Cisco #Firepower #zeroday

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T21:42:33.777Z ##

HOT OFF THE PRESS! Microsoft MSRC updated a different security advisory, for CVE-2024-21410 (9.8 critical) , marking it as exploited. This is the third* zero-day of February 2024 Patch Tuesday. Microsoft Exchange Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. This is after they mistakenly updated CVE-2024-21413 as exploited, which even caught the Check Point Researcher vulnerability submitter by surprise.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21410

cc: @serghei @todb @campuscodi @deepthoughts10 @briankrebs @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_21410 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #Outlook #Microsoft #PatchTuesday #RCE #MonikerLink

  • CVE-2024-21410 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, updated 14 Feb as exploited zero-day) Microsoft Exchange Server Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

##
nathans at 2024-02-15T03:58:32.224Z ##

Microsoft: New critical Exchange bug exploited as zero-day

Microsoft warned today in an updated security advisory that a critical vulnerability in Exchange Server was exploited as a zero-day before being fixed during this month's Patch Tuesday.

Discovered internally and tracked as CVE-2024-21410, this security flaw can let remote unauthenticated threat actors escalate privileges in NTLM relay attacks targeting vulnerable Microsoft Exchange Server versions.

#News #Tech #Microsoft #Exchange #Vulnerability #Security #Cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/microsoft-new-critical-exchange-bug-exploited-as-zero-day/

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T22:05:35.203Z ##

@GossiTheDog @briankrebs @serghei @todb @campuscodi @deepthoughts10 My thought process is that they found evidence of CVE-2024-21410 exploitation as a zero-day but mistakenly updated CVE-2024-21413 because similar CVE ID and CVSSv3 score of 9.8. Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability sounds like Microsoft Exchange Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability some days. Happens to the best of us right??

##
TheDustinChilds at 2024-02-14T21:50:05.316Z ##

What is going on at @msftsecresponse? After updating CVE-2024-21413 (Outlook) to indicate it's under active attack, they changed it to say it ISN'T under attack but CVE-2024-21410 (Exchange) IS under attack. I'm updating my blog (again) to reflect this. https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/2/13/the-february-2024-security-update-review

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T18:51:01.636Z ##

FALSE ALARM! Microsoft MSRC mistakenly updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-21413 (9.8 critical, Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability), marking it as exploited.

Mistakenly updated exploited flag and exploitability assessment to indicate exploitation existed. Reverting values to no. This is an informational change only.

🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21413

NOTE: CVE-2024-21410 was marked exploited instead! See reply toot.

#CVE_2024_21413 #vulnerability #Outlook #Microsoft #PatchTuesday #RCE #MonikerLink

##

CVE-2024-21413
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

32 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/duy-31/CVE-2024-21413

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-15T06:11:08.011Z ##

"🚨Critical Outlook RCE Vulnerability Actively exploited - CVE-2024-21413 Unleashed🚨"

Security researchers have unveiled a critical Microsoft Outlook vulnerability, CVE-2024-21413, which allows attackers to execute remote code (RCE) when opening emails with malicious links using a vulnerable Microsoft Outlook version. A patch was released but threat actors are actively exploiting any unpatched servers.

This vulnerability, having a CVSS score of 9.8, affects Microsoft Office 2016 versions of Microsoft Outlook prior to build number 16.0.5435.1001 on Windows. The flaw lets attackers get around Protected View, which is supposed to stop harmful content in Office files by opening them in read-only mode. They can then open malicious Office files in editing mode, which can lead to the leaking of local NTLM credential information and remote code execution (RCE).

date_created: 2024-02-13T18:16:00
date_modified: 2024-02-13T18:22:00

attackComplexity: LOW
attackVector: NETWORK
availabilityImpact: HIGH
baseScore: 9.8
baseSeverity: CRITICAL
userInteraction: NONE
vectorString: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
privilegesRequired: NONE

Tags: #CyberSecurity #MicrosoftOutlook #CVE202421413 #RCE #NTLMTheft #PatchNow #InfoSec

🔗 MITRE CVE-2023-23397 and NVD

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-02-13T20:55:04.000Z ##

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-02-13T20:55:04.000Z ##

Microsoft Confirms Windows Exploits Bypassing Security Features https://www.securityweek.com/microsoft-confirms-windows-exploits-bypassing-security-features/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202421412 #CVE202421413 #CVE202421451 #PatchTuesday

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-15T06:11:08.000Z ##

"🚨Critical Outlook RCE Vulnerability Actively exploited - CVE-2024-21413 Unleashed🚨"

Security researchers have unveiled a critical Microsoft Outlook vulnerability, CVE-2024-21413, which allows attackers to execute remote code (RCE) when opening emails with malicious links using a vulnerable Microsoft Outlook version. A patch was released but threat actors are actively exploiting any unpatched servers.

This vulnerability, having a CVSS score of 9.8, affects Microsoft Office 2016 versions of Microsoft Outlook prior to build number 16.0.5435.1001 on Windows. The flaw lets attackers get around Protected View, which is supposed to stop harmful content in Office files by opening them in read-only mode. They can then open malicious Office files in editing mode, which can lead to the leaking of local NTLM credential information and remote code execution (RCE).

date_created: 2024-02-13T18:16:00
date_modified: 2024-02-13T18:22:00

attackComplexity: LOW
attackVector: NETWORK
availabilityImpact: HIGH
baseScore: 9.8
baseSeverity: CRITICAL
userInteraction: NONE
vectorString: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
privilegesRequired: NONE

Tags: #CyberSecurity #MicrosoftOutlook #CVE202421413 #RCE #NTLMTheft #PatchNow #InfoSec

🔗 MITRE CVE-2023-23397 and NVD

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T18:51:01.636Z ##

FALSE ALARM! Microsoft MSRC mistakenly updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-21413 (9.8 critical, Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability), marking it as exploited.

Mistakenly updated exploited flag and exploitability assessment to indicate exploitation existed. Reverting values to no. This is an informational change only.

🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21413

NOTE: CVE-2024-21410 was marked exploited instead! See reply toot.

#CVE_2024_21413 #vulnerability #Outlook #Microsoft #PatchTuesday #RCE #MonikerLink

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T15:55:47.635Z ##

Check Point Research goes into detail about a Microsoft Outlook vulnerability they discovered dubbed #MonikerLink, that allows for leaking the local NTLM credential information and even remote code execution. "Note that we added a "!" at the end of the "test.rtf" and also added some random characters "something". Such a link will bypass the previously discussed existing Outlook security restriction" MonikerLink was given the CVE ID of CVE-2024-21413 and patched yesterday in February 2024 Patch Tuesday.
🔗 https://research.checkpoint.com/2024/the-risks-of-the-monikerlink-bug-in-microsoft-outlook-and-the-big-picture/

#CVE_2024_21413 #vulnerability #Outlook #Microsoft #PatchTuesday #RCE #MonikerLink

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-14T18:51:01.000Z ##

FALSE ALARM! Microsoft MSRC mistakenly updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-21413 (9.8 critical, Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability), marking it as exploited.

Mistakenly updated exploited flag and exploitability assessment to indicate exploitation existed. Reverting values to no. This is an informational change only.

🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21413

NOTE: CVE-2024-21410 was marked exploited instead! See reply toot.

#CVE_2024_21413 #vulnerability #Outlook #Microsoft #PatchTuesday #RCE #MonikerLink

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-14T15:55:47.000Z ##

Check Point Research goes into detail about a Microsoft Outlook vulnerability they discovered dubbed #MonikerLink, that allows for leaking the local NTLM credential information and even remote code execution. "Note that we added a "!" at the end of the "test.rtf" and also added some random characters "something". Such a link will bypass the previously discussed existing Outlook security restriction" MonikerLink was given the CVE ID of CVE-2024-21413 and patched yesterday in February 2024 Patch Tuesday.
🔗 https://research.checkpoint.com/2024/the-risks-of-the-monikerlink-bug-in-microsoft-outlook-and-the-big-picture/

zeljkazorz at 2024-02-15T10:08:26.497Z ##

@TheDustinChilds My guess is that they originally wanted to update CVE-2024-21410, but the person mistakenly updated CVE-2024-21413 and then realized their error.

##
stk@mountains.social at 2024-02-15T08:33:47.000Z ##

If you are a windows client admin you might want to patch your ms office clients asap.
It's not yet exploited, but remotecode execution by outlook preview pane might be fatal.
"Yes, the Preview Pane is an attack vector." and
"An attacker could craft a malicious link that bypasses the Protected View Protocol, which leads to the leaking of local NTLM credential information and remote code execution (RCE)."

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21413

#InfoSec #outlook #microsoft #msoffice

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T22:05:35.203Z ##

@GossiTheDog @briankrebs @serghei @todb @campuscodi @deepthoughts10 My thought process is that they found evidence of CVE-2024-21410 exploitation as a zero-day but mistakenly updated CVE-2024-21413 because similar CVE ID and CVSSv3 score of 9.8. Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability sounds like Microsoft Exchange Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability some days. Happens to the best of us right??

##
TheDustinChilds at 2024-02-14T21:50:05.316Z ##

What is going on at @msftsecresponse? After updating CVE-2024-21413 (Outlook) to indicate it's under active attack, they changed it to say it ISN'T under attack but CVE-2024-21410 (Exchange) IS under attack. I'm updating my blog (again) to reflect this. https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/2/13/the-february-2024-security-update-review

##
simontsui at 2024-02-14T21:42:33.777Z ##

HOT OFF THE PRESS! Microsoft MSRC updated a different security advisory, for CVE-2024-21410 (9.8 critical) , marking it as exploited. This is the third* zero-day of February 2024 Patch Tuesday. Microsoft Exchange Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. This is after they mistakenly updated CVE-2024-21413 as exploited, which even caught the Check Point Researcher vulnerability submitter by surprise.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21410

cc: @serghei @todb @campuscodi @deepthoughts10 @briankrebs @GossiTheDog

##
briankrebs at 2024-02-14T20:24:01.452Z ##

Heads up: Microsoft has updated its security advisory for the critical Outlook bug they patched on Tuesday, the one that can be exploited just by a malicious message being viewed in the preview pane. They're now saying it's under active attack.

This remote code execution vulnerability is assigned a CVSS3.1 (badness) score of 9.8.

EDIT: Someone just pointed out that MS has changed the advisory back to the way it was, saying it's NOT currently being exploited.

https://infosec.exchange/@simontsui/111931337056708824

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21413

https://krebsonsecurity.com/2024/02/fat-patch-tuesday-february-2024-edition/#more-66378

CVE-2024-23917
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

4 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.3 authentication bypass leading to RCE was possible

simontsui at 2024-02-09T17:26:38.443Z ##

You'd think that CISA would be on top of JetBrains TeamCity after their own joint cybersecurity advisory from 2 months ago warning of Russian Foreign Intelligence Service exploitation of CVE-2023-42793, but they posted a cybersecurity alert about CVE-2024-23917 four days later. They should hire me to update their blog. Anyway, this is a reminder to patch your TeamCity.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/02/09/jetbrains-releases-security-advisory-teamcity-premises

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass #CISA

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-09T17:26:38.000Z ##

You'd think that CISA would be on top of JetBrains TeamCity after their own joint cybersecurity advisory from 2 months ago warning of Russian Foreign Intelligence Service exploitation of CVE-2023-42793, but they posted a cybersecurity alert about CVE-2024-23917 four days later. They should hire me to update their blog. Anyway, this is a reminder to patch your TeamCity.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass #CISA

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T18:16:02.000Z ##

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23917:
Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) exploited a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793 (9.8 critical) worldwide, as reported in a CISA cybersecurity advisory dated 13 December 2023, less than 2 months ago. APT29, aka Cozy Bear is a state-sponsored cyber actor that exploited CVE-2023-42793 at a large scale, targeting servers hosting JetBrains TeamCity software since September 2023.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass #Russia #SVR #APT29 #CozyBear #cyberespionage

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T17:34:11.000Z ##

Yet another JetBrains TeamCity On-Prem vulnerability: CVE-2024-23917 (9.8 critical)

If abused, the flaw may enable an unauthenticated attacker with HTTP(S) access to a TeamCity server to bypass authentication checks and gain administrative control of that TeamCity server.

🔗 https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/02/critical-security-issue-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-23917/

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass

  • SSH Terrapin Prefix Truncation Weakness CVE-2023-48795 (5.9 medium) Note: Terrapin Attack

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2023-5044
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

2 posts

A security issue was identified in [ingress-nginx](https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx) where the nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/permanent-redirect annotation on an Ingress object (in the networking.k8s.io or extensions API group) can be used to inject arbitrary commands, and obtain the credentials of the ingress-nginx controller. In the default configuration, that credential has access to al

2 repos

https://github.com/r0binak/CVE-2023-5044

https://github.com/4ARMED/cve-2023-5044

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-02-13T18:07:03.000Z ##

This article delves into Kubernetes ingress nginx controller vulnerabilities, mainly CVE-2023-5044's exploitation using annotations, Lua and command injection, highlighting its (low) risk due to role-based permissions

➜ https://raesene.github.io/blog/2023/10/29/exploiting-CVE-2023-5044

##
kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-02-13T18:07:03.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-0517
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

1 posts

Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T14:25:52.000Z ##

Exodus Intelligence provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-0517, (8.8 high severity, disclosed 16 January by Google) an out of bounds write vulnerability in V8. This vulnerability arose due to how V8’s Maglev compiler tried to optimize the number of allocations that it makes. Exodus was able to exploit this bug by leveraging V8’s garbage collector to gain read/write in the V8 heap. They then used a Wasm instance object in V8, which still has a raw 64-bit pointer to the Wasm RWX memory to bypass Ubercage and gain code execution inside the Chrome sandbox. CVE-2024-0517 was upstaged by 0519 (8.8 high Out of bounds memory access in V8) which was announced as exploited in the wild.

"Apart from fixing the vulnerability, an upstream V8 commit was recently introduced to move the WASM instance into a new Trusted Space, thereby rendering this method of bypassing the Ubercage ineffective."

🔗 https://blog.exodusintel.com/2024/01/19/google-chrome-v8-cve-2024-0517-out-of-bounds-write-code-execution/

#CVE_2024_0517 #Google #Chrome #vulnerability #RCA #poc

##

CVE-2024-23109
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

9 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

simontsui at 2024-02-09T18:11:48.446Z ##

Speaking of which, Fortinet updated their 10 October 2023 security advisory sometime between 08-09 February 2024 for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 backdated 31 January: "Updated with two variants (CVE-2024-23108, CVE-2024-23109), updated versions in Solution accordingly".

Fortinet is pleased to thank security researchers Zach Hanley (@hacks_zach) of Horizon3.ai for discovering and reporting this vulnerability under responsible disclosure.

🔗 https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130
Analyst Note: The patched versions have been updated, compared to the archived page from web.archive.org dated 06 February 2024.

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM #CVE_2023_34992

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-02-09T09:12:12.000Z ##

"In this instance, due to an issue with the API which we are currently investigating, rather than an edit, this resulted in two new CVEs being created, duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992," Fortinet told BleepingComputer.

However, it turns out that CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are actually patch bypasses for the CVE-2023-34992 flaw discovered by Horizon3 vulnerability expert Zach Hanley.

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-02-09T09:12:09.000Z ##

Vorgestern war auch Fortigate Patchday:

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/
CVE-2024-23108, CVE-2024-23109 als Patch für einen failed Patch CVE-2023-34992.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-09T18:11:48.000Z ##

Speaking of which, Fortinet updated their 10 October 2023 security advisory sometime between 08-09 February 2024 for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 backdated 31 January: "Updated with two variants (CVE-2024-23108, CVE-2024-23109), updated versions in Solution accordingly".

Fortinet is pleased to thank security researchers Zach Hanley (@hacks_zach) of Horizon3.ai for discovering and reporting this vulnerability under responsible disclosure.

🔗 https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130
Analyst Note: The patched versions have been updated, compared to the archived page from web.archive.org dated 06 February 2024.

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM #CVE_2023_34992

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-02-09T09:12:12.000Z ##

"In this instance, due to an issue with the API which we are currently investigating, rather than an edit, this resulted in two new CVEs being created, duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992," Fortinet told BleepingComputer.

However, it turns out that CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are actually patch bypasses for the CVE-2023-34992 flaw discovered by Horizon3 vulnerability expert Zach Hanley.

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-02-09T09:12:09.000Z ##

Vorgestern war auch Fortigate Patchday:

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/
CVE-2024-23108, CVE-2024-23109 als Patch für einen failed Patch CVE-2023-34992.

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T13:30:57.000Z ##

Fortinet added the two new vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to the original advisory for the CVE-2023-34992 flaw in a very confusing update. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T03:29:22.000Z ##

Fortinet lied after hiding vulnerabilities in an old advisory: @hacks_zach of Horizon3 posted a screenshot of his email with Fortinet PSIRT showing that he submitted CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109. These are patch bypass vulnerabilities of CVE-2023-34992, according to a new and updated Bleeping Computer article.
🔗 Zach Hanley tweet: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695/photo/1
Bleeping Computer article: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM #CVE_2023_34992

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T21:05:45.000Z ##

Wake up sheeple: Fortinet just tried to hide two maximum severity vulnerabilities in an older security advisory:

  • CVE-2024-23108 (10.0 critical)
  • CVE-2024-23109 (10.0 critical)

Both have the same description: "An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests."
🔗(10 October 2023) https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130

EDIT 07 February 2024: According to Bleeping Computer, these are legitimate vulnerabilities once again: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM

##

CVE-2024-23108
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

9 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

simontsui at 2024-02-09T18:11:48.446Z ##

Speaking of which, Fortinet updated their 10 October 2023 security advisory sometime between 08-09 February 2024 for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 backdated 31 January: "Updated with two variants (CVE-2024-23108, CVE-2024-23109), updated versions in Solution accordingly".

Fortinet is pleased to thank security researchers Zach Hanley (@hacks_zach) of Horizon3.ai for discovering and reporting this vulnerability under responsible disclosure.

🔗 https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130
Analyst Note: The patched versions have been updated, compared to the archived page from web.archive.org dated 06 February 2024.

serghei@mastodon.social at 2024-02-07T11:11:09.000Z ##

@simontsui Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992.

Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating.

##

CVE-2024-23653
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

1 posts

### Impact In addition to running containers as build steps, BuildKit also provides APIs for running interactive containers based on built images. It was possible to use these APIs to ask BuildKit to run a container with elevated privileges. Normally, running such containers is only allowed if special `security.insecure` entitlement is enabled both by buildkitd configuration and allowed by the use

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-03T15:30:45.000Z ##

The flaws are collectively called Leaky Vessels and they are tracked as CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-23651, CVE-2024-23653 and CVE-2024-23652. https://www.securityweek.com/leaky-vessels-container-escape-vulnerabilities-impact-docker-others/

##

CVE-2023-45025
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 0.07%

1 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow users to execute commands via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following versions: QTS 5.1.4.2596 build 20231128 and later QTS 4.5.4.2627 build 20231225 and later QuTS hero h5.1.4.2596 build 20231128 and later QuTS hero h4.5

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T16:20:00.000Z ##

#QNAP Patches High-Severity Bugs in QTS, Qsync Central

High severity OS command #injection flaws ( CVE-2023-45025 and CVE-2023-39297) found in some QNAP devices.

Also two remotely exploitable flaws (OS command injections and SQL injection) tracked as CVE-2023-47567 and CVE-2023-47568.

According to QNAP, no evidence these vulnerabilities have been exploited in the wild.

If you have a device, you should update ASAP!

#cybersecurity #cve #security #update

https://www.securityweek.com/qnap-patches-high-severity-bugs-in-qts-qsync-central/

##

CVE-2024-23651
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

1 posts

### Impact Two malicious build steps running in parallel sharing the same cache mounts with subpaths could cause a race condition that can lead to files from the host system being accessible to the build container. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing cache mounts with

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-03T15:30:45.000Z ##

The flaws are collectively called Leaky Vessels and they are tracked as CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-23651, CVE-2024-23653 and CVE-2024-23652. https://www.securityweek.com/leaky-vessels-container-escape-vulnerabilities-impact-docker-others/

##

CVE-2024-23652
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

### Impact A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using `RUN --mount` could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing `RUN --mount`

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-03T15:30:45.000Z ##

The flaws are collectively called Leaky Vessels and they are tracked as CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-23651, CVE-2024-23653 and CVE-2024-23652. https://www.securityweek.com/leaky-vessels-container-escape-vulnerabilities-impact-docker-others/

##

CVE-2024-20290
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

A vulnerability in the OLE2 file format parser of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an incorrect check for end-of-string values during scanning, which may result in a heap buffer over-read. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting a crafted file containing OLE2

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-07T16:12:18.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • ClamAV OLE2 File Format Parsing Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20290 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco Expressway Series Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20252, CVE-2024-20254, CVE-2024-20255 (9.6 critical)
    • Note: Cisco's own URL in advisory is missing 'csrf' which is a broken link. Please use https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-expressway-csrf-KnnZDMj3

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory #ClamAV #CiscoExpressway

##

CVE-2024-21888
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

11 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator.

krlaboratories at 2024-02-14T20:23:10.078Z ##

Невеличкий PDF-звіт від компанії Hive Pro, який проливає світло на атаку на сервери компанії Ivanti.

https://www.hivepro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Ivanti-Addresses-Zero-Day-Vulnerability-Exploited-in-Attacks_TA2024042.pdf

Ivanti — це американська IT-компанія з Юти, яка розробляє програмні рішення з кібербезпеки, для управління ІТ-послугами та активами.

В Лютому 2024 були оприлюднені дві критичні вразливості CVE-2024-21893 і CVE-2024-21888. Невдовзі стало відомо, що хакери провели SSRF-атаку на сервери Ivanti.

Зловмисники знайшли діру на боці сервера, а саме в його компоненті SAML, який заснований на протоколі XML і відповідає за обмін ідентифікаторами автентифікації та авторизації.

Хакери скористались недостатньою валідацією вхідних даних і провели експлойт.

Успішна експлуатація цієї діри привела до встановлення бекдора DSLog, який дозволяє зловмисникам віддалено виконувати команди від імені root на зламаних серверах Ivanti.

Якщо підсумувати, то хакери просто відправляли шкідливі запити (malicious requests), які обманом змусили сервер надсилати їх до своїх внутрішніх ресурсів (без перевірки) й отримати таким чином доступ до сенситивних, конфіденційних даних. Все по класиці.

Важливо відзначити, що ця вразливість сьогодні не рідкість - SSRF набирає потужних обертів і експлуатується повсюдно. На сьогодні чимало веб-додатків і хмарних платформ є вразливими до SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery).

#ivanti #cybersecurity #securitynews #hacking #hack #hackers #servers #infrastructure #itsecurity #reports #research #кібербезпека #CVE_2024_21893 #CVE_2024_21888 #ssrf

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.969Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888
#CVE_2024_21893

cc: @todb @ntkramer @serghei @dangoodin @catc0n

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.000Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888
#CVE_2024_21893

cc: @todb @ntkramer @serghei @dangoodin @catc0n

Невеличкий PDF-звіт від компанії Hive Pro, який проливає світло на атаку на сервери компанії Ivanti.

https://www.hivepro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Ivanti-Addresses-Zero-Day-Vulnerability-Exploited-in-Attacks_TA2024042.pdf

Ivanti — це американська IT-компанія з Юти, яка розробляє програмні рішення з кібербезпеки, для управління ІТ-послугами та активами.

В Лютому 2024 були оприлюднені дві критичні вразливості CVE-2024-21893 і CVE-2024-21888. Невдовзі стало відомо, що хакери провели SSRF-атаку на сервери Ivanti.

Зловмисники знайшли діру на боці сервера, а саме в його компоненті SAML, який заснований на протоколі XML і відповідає за обмін ідентифікаторами автентифікації та авторизації.

Хакери скористались недостатньою валідацією вхідних даних і провели експлойт.

Успішна експлуатація цієї діри привела до встановлення бекдора DSLog, який дозволяє зловмисникам віддалено виконувати команди від імені root на зламаних серверах Ivanti.

Якщо підсумувати, то хакери просто відправляли шкідливі запити (malicious requests), які обманом змусили сервер надсилати їх до своїх внутрішніх ресурсів (без перевірки) й отримати таким чином доступ до сенситивних, конфіденційних даних. Все по класиці.

Важливо відзначити, що ця вразливість сьогодні не рідкість - SSRF набирає потужних обертів і експлуатується повсюдно. На сьогодні чимало веб-додатків і хмарних платформ є вразливими до SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery).

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.000Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888

cc: @todb @ntkramer @serghei @dangoodin @catc0n

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-02-08T21:44:52.000Z ##

Oh man, Ivanti is going for the full list of attack vectors, huh?

First we got the auth-bypass (CVE-2023-46805) and the command-injection (CVE-2024-21887), then we added privilege-escalation (CVE-2024-21888) and an SSRF (CVE-2024-21893), and today we get CVE-2024-22024, an XXE vulnerability in their SAML that provides unauth'd access to some components.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-02-08T21:44:52.000Z ##

Oh man, Ivanti is going for the full list of attack vectors, huh?

First we got the auth-bypass (CVE-2023-46805) and the command-injection (CVE-2024-21887), then we added privilege-escalation (CVE-2024-21888) and an SSRF (CVE-2024-21893), and today we get CVE-2024-22024, an XXE vulnerability in their SAML that provides unauth'd access to some components.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T15:10:37.000Z ##

@wdormann I have to disagree here. Ivanti created a new advisory (originally created 22 January for logged in Ivanti customers, and made public on 31 January) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US , and updated both the blog https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways and the older advisory from 10 January https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US which everyone was following for updates.

##
avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T21:18:25.000Z ##

Parę słów o tym, dlaczego CISA dała amerykańskim agencjom federalnym tylko 48 godz. na uporanie się z lukami w VPN-ach firmy Ivanti. Otóż luki pozwalające przejąć nad nimi kontrolę dodała do swego arsenału wspierana przez chiński rząd grupa APT, którą Volexity identyfikuje jako UTA0178, a Mandiant jako UNC5221.

Ataki zaczęły się na początku grudnia i przybrały charakter globalny (przejęte urządzenia znajdują się też w Polsce, choć w porównaniu z USA niewiele). W styczniu badacze przeanalizowali wykorzystanie CVE-2023-46805 i CVE-2024-21887. Pierwsza z wymienionych luk pozwala na ominięcie uwierzytelniania. Druga umożliwia wstrzyknięcie dowolnego polecenia w panelu webowym takich urządzeń, jak Ivanti Connect Secure i Ivanti Policy Secure. Atakujący posłużyli się nimi, by wykraść dane, za pomocą których logowali się później do wewnętrznych systemów przez RDP/SMB/SSH.

Ledwo Ivanti wydało stosowne poprawki, wykryto jeszcze dwie luki. CVE-2024-21888 umożliwia podniesienie poziomu uprawnień, a CVE-2024-21893 jest błędem po stronie serwera, który daje dostęp do określonych zasobów bez uwierzytelniania. Drugą z wymienionych luk zainteresowali się już przestępcy.

Analizy Volexity:
1. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/10/active-exploitation-of-two-zero-day-vulnerabilities-in-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn/
2. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/
3. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-new-observations/
4. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/02/01/how-memory-forensics-revealed-exploitation-of-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day-vulnerabilities/

Analizy Mandianta:
1. https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day
2. https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #ivanti

CVE-2023-47568
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

A SQL injection vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow authenticated users to inject malicious code via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following versions: QTS 5.1.5.2645 build 20240116 and later QTS 4.5.4.2627 build 20231225 and later QuTS hero h5.1.5.2647 build 20240118 and later QuT

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T16:20:00.000Z ##

#QNAP Patches High-Severity Bugs in QTS, Qsync Central

High severity OS command #injection flaws ( CVE-2023-45025 and CVE-2023-39297) found in some QNAP devices.

Also two remotely exploitable flaws (OS command injections and SQL injection) tracked as CVE-2023-47567 and CVE-2023-47568.

According to QNAP, no evidence these vulnerabilities have been exploited in the wild.

If you have a device, you should update ASAP!

#cybersecurity #cve #security #update

https://www.securityweek.com/qnap-patches-high-severity-bugs-in-qts-qsync-central/

CVE-2024-23447
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

An issue was discovered in the Windows Network Drive Connector when using Document Level Security to assign permissions to a file, with explicit allow write and deny read. Although the document is not accessible to the user in Network Drive it is visible in search applications to the user.

##

CVE-2024-23446
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

An issue was discovered by Elastic, whereby the Detection Engine Search API does not respect Document-level security (DLS) or Field-level security (FLS) when querying the .alerts-security.alerts-{space_id} indices. Users who are authorized to call this API may obtain unauthorized access to documents if their roles are configured with DLS or FLS against the aforementioned index.

##

CVE-2023-50387(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

23 posts

Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4035 and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIG records, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. The protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluate all combinations of DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

frehi@fosstodon.org at 2024-02-15T07:52:09.000Z ##

Disappointing that @debian did not yet release security updates fixing #keytrap for #knotResolver

#dns #debian #CVE202350868 #CVE202350387 CVE_2023_50868 #CVE_2023500387

##
tychotithonus at 2024-02-13T22:51:51.189Z ##

I have two posts about the new multi-implementation DNSSEC validation DoS vulnerabilities CVE-2023-50387 ("KeyTrap") and CVE-2023-50868 (the NSEC3 vuln):

  • The big summary post (more editing - your client may notify you about each edit, which may be a feature):

https://infosec.exchange/@tychotithonus/111924626712765292

  • The post you're reading (low editing, minimal noise, but you might want to check the big post occasionally for updates).

#keytrap #nsec3 #CVE202350387 #CVE202350868 #CVE_2023_50387 #CVE_2023_50868
#dns #dnssec

##
tychotithonus at 2024-02-13T14:24:29.911Z ##

(living doc, updated regularly - if you prefer a low-edit post to boost, use https://infosec.exchange/@tychotithonus/111926621712441626)

Looks like DNS-OARC coordinated fixes in advance, but no centralized analysis at first other than the announcement from the team who discovered KeyTrap:
https://www.athene-center.de/en/news/press/key-trap
... and their technical paper (released 2/15):
https://www.athene-center.de/fileadmin/content/PDF/Technical_Report_KeyTrap.pdf

Details may be still partially embargoed until patching ramps up.

Analysis:

DoS of all major DNSSEC-validating DNS resolvers (servers, but also maybe local resolvers like systemd's?) at the implementation level. Exploitation described as 'trivial'. Both are CVSS 7.5. DNS is a rich ransom target - but some resolver setups don't even validate DNSSEC.

"In 2012 the vulnerability made its way into the implementation requirements for DNSSEC validation, standards RFC 6781 and RFC 6840" (per ATHENE)

Per the Unbound writeup, both vulns require query to a malicious zone (which is probably not hard to trigger, for any DNSSEC-enabled client or server).

Resolution: patch (recommended); disable DNSSEC validation (discouraged, but can buy you time / mitigate active DoS)

Fixes mitigate the exhaustion by putting caps on validation activities. These caps appear to have been missing from most implementations.

Details:

Two DNSSEC DoS CVEs:

CVE-2023-50387 ("KeyTrap"): "DNSSEC verification complexity can be exploited to exhaust CPU resources and stall DNS resolvers" (CVSS 7.5)
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2024/q1/125

(KeyTrap was discovered by ATHENE - their press release here has very important detail:
https://www.athene-center.de/en/news/press/key-trap)

CVE-2023-50868: "NSEC3 closest encloser proof can exhaust CPU" (CVSS 7.5)
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

MITRE links (now populated):
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-50387
https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-50868

Vulmon queries:
https://vulmon.com/searchpage?q=CVE-2023-50387
https://vulmon.com/searchpage?q=CVE-2023-50868

VulDB:
https://vuldb.com/?id.253829

Patch status:

ISC BIND (patched - vuln since 2000?):
https://fosstodon.org/@iscdotorg/111924416653890048
https://kb.isc.org/docs/cve-2023-50387
https://kb.isc.org/docs/cve-2023-50868
https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2024/q1/125
https://www.isc.org/blogs/2024-bind-security-release/
(note: posts say "Versions prior to 9.11.37 were not assessed." but also have a range of affected versions starting at 9.0.0 - typo?)

Unbound (patched - vuln since Aug 2007):
https://nlnetlabs.nl/news/2024/Feb/13/unbound-1.19.1-released/
https://nlnetlabs.nl/downloads/unbound/CVE-2023-50387_CVE-2023-50868.txt
https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2024/q1/126

dnsmasq (patched - 2.90 has fix):
https://thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/CHANGELOG
https://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2024q1/017430.html

Knot (patched in 5.7.1):
https://www.knot-resolver.cz/2024-02-13-knot-resolver-5.7.1.html

pfSense:
(Bundled Unbound: plan appears to be to make a separate package available for manual update?; BIND: optional package)
https://forum.netgate.com/topic/186145/unbound-cve-2023-50387-and-cve-2023-50868/1
https://redmine.pfsense.org/issues/15256

Pi-Hole (uses dnsmasq - patch available)
https://www.patreon.com/posts/dnssec-fix-98498055
https://pi-hole.net/blog/2024/02/13/fixing-two-new-dnssec-vulnerabilities/

PowerDNS (patched - all versions affected):
https://blog.powerdns.com/2024/02/13/powerdns-recursor-4-8-6-4-9-3-5-0-2-released
https://github.com/PowerDNS/pdns/pull/13781
https://github.com/PowerDNS/pdns/pull/13784
https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2024/q1/130

systemd.resolved:
[?]

https://www.akamai.com/blog/security/dns-exploit-keytrap-posed-major-internet-threat

https://umbrella.cisco.com/blog [?]

https://coredns.io/blog/ [?]

[?]
(The Register article (see below) says Google is aware)

Infoblox:
https://blogs.infoblox.com/ [?]

Quad9 DNS:
https://www.quad9.net/news/blog/ [?]

News/Press

https://www.theregister.com/2024/02/13/dnssec_vulnerability_internet/

https://www.securityweek.com/keytrap-dns-attack-could-disable-large-parts-of-internet-researchers/

Detection/Validation:

Check to see if a server is doing DNSSEC validation (if not an open recursive resolver, you may need to query a zone the server is authoritative for):

# zone signed, server DNSSEC-enabled:
$ delv example.net @8.8.8.8
; fully validated
example.net.            4437    IN      A       93.184.216.34
example.net.            4437    IN      RRSIG   A 13 2 86400 20240225232039 20240204162038 18113 example.net. 94G2PRXins1G9ntfklvCq2mvcgqjB0z9FqQXp77lD/wXR4J3D67ceih1 yNgsYYqlIAOoWKXUekux6Zq9aIwszQ==

# zone unsigned, server DNSSEC-enabled:
$ delv google.com @8.8.8.8
; unsigned answer
google.com.             100     IN      A       142.250.69.206

Tenable:
https://www.tenable.com/plugins/pipeline/issues/165587

Exploits:

(none yet known / public, but multiple sources describe as "trivial")

#keytrap #nsec3 #CVE202350387 #CVE202350868 #CVE_2023_50387 #CVE_2023_50868
#dns #dnssec

Looks like DNS-OARC coordinated fixes in advance, but no centralized analysis at first other than the announcement from the team who discovered KeyTrap:
https://www.athene-center.de/en/news/press/key-trap
... and their technical paper (released 2/15):
https://www.athene-center.de/fileadmin/content/PDF/Technical_Report_KeyTrap.pdf
